First, let’s create account get access data. create Earthdata login via https://wiki.earthdata.nasa.gov/display/EL/++Register++Earthdata+Login don’t already one need know URL actual data. metadata record data set contains “Download via HTTPS” link, turn directs user URL: https://daacdata.apps.nsidc.org/pub/DATASETS/nsidc0192_seaice_trends_climo_v3/. ’s data URL (used source_url data source definition) browse data URL, using Earthdata login authenticate. use access Earthdata application first time, requested authorize can access data using credentials (see https://wiki.earthdata.nasa.gov/display/EL/++Register++Earthdata+Login). dataset served NSIDC DAAC application, need authorize application (either browsing just described, go ‘Applications’ https://urs.earthdata.nasa.gov/profile add application ‘nsidc-daacdata’ list authorized applications) need create Earthdata login . want download Earthdata data sets via bowerbird, ’ll use credentials, note may need authorize additional applications, depending extra data sets come . Now access data, can write bowerbird data source: similar previous examples, differences: method specifies bb_handler_earthdata (whereas previously used bb_handler_rget). bb_handler_earthdata actually just wrapper around bb_handler_rget, takes care Earthdata-specific details like authentication using Earthdata credentials relative = TRUE means bb_rget follow relative links (.e. links form <href="//directory/">...</>, definition must server source_url). Absolute links (.e. links form <href="http://..server//path">...</> followed. another mechanism prevent recursive download downloading stuff don’t want specified file types want via accept_download parameter. Note providing data source definition people use, obviously want hard-code Earthdata credentials user password slots. case, specify credentials empty strings, also include warn_empty_auth = FALSE data source definition (suppresses warning bb_source otherwise give missing credentials): another user wants use data source, simply insert credentials, e.g.:
code: src3 <- bb_source(     name = "Sea Ice Trends and Climatologies from SMMR and SSM/I-SSMIS, Version 3",     id = "10.5067/IJ0T7HFHB9Y6",     description = "NSIDC provides this data set to aid in the investigations of the variability and trends of sea ice cover. Ice cover in these data are indicated by sea ice concentration: the percentage of the ocean surface covered by ice. The ice-covered area indicates how much ice is present; it is the total area of a pixel multiplied by the ice concentration in that pixel. Ice persistence is the percentage of months over the data set time period that ice existed at a location. The ice-extent indicates whether ice is present; here, ice is considered to exist in a pixel if the sea ice concentration exceeds 15 percent. This data set provides users with data about total ice-covered areas, sea ice extent, ice persistence, and monthly climatologies of sea ice concentrations.",     doc_url = "https://doi.org/10.5067/IJ0T7HFHB9Y6",     citation = "Stroeve J, Meier WN (2018) Sea Ice Trends and Climatologies from SMMR and SSM/I-SSMIS, Version 3. [Indicate subset used]. Boulder, Colorado USA. NASA National Snow and Ice Data Center Distributed Active Archive Center. doi:10.5067/IJ0T7HFHB9Y6. [Date Accessed].",     source_url = c("https://daacdata.apps.nsidc.org/pub/DATASETS/nsidc0192_seaice_trends_climo_v3/"),     license = "Please cite, see http://nsidc.org/about/use_copyright.html",     authentication_note = "Requires Earthdata login, see https://wiki.earthdata.nasa.gov/display/EL/How+To+Register+With+Earthdata+Login . Note that you will also need to authorize the application 'nsidc-daacdata' (see 'My Applications' at https://urs.earthdata.nasa.gov/profile)",     method = list("bb_handler_earthdata", level = 4, relative = TRUE, accept_download = "\\.(s|n|png|txt)$"),     user = "your_earthdata_username",     password = "your_earthdata_password",     collection_size = 0.02,     data_group = "Sea ice") src3 <- bb_source(     name = "Sea Ice Trends and Climatologies from SMMR and SSM/I-SSMIS, Version 3",     ... details as above...,     user = "",     password = "",     warn_empty_auth = FALSE) mysrc <- src3 mysrc$user <- "theirusername" mysrc$password <- "theirpassword"  ## or, do the same with the pipe operator and bb_modify_source mysrc <- src3 %>% bb_modify_source(user = "theirusername", password = "theirpassword")  ## then proceed as per usual cf <- bb_add(cf, mysrc)

text: NASA’s Oceandata system provides access range satellite-derived marine data products. bb_oceandata_handler can used download data. uses two-step process: first makes query Oceancolour data file search tool (https://oceandata.sci.gsfc.nasa.gov/search/file_search.cgi) find files match specified criterion, downloads matching files. Oceandata uses standardized file naming conventions (see https://oceancolor.gsfc.nasa.gov/docs/format/), know products want can construct suitable file name pattern search . example, “S*L3m_MO_CHL_chlor_a_9km.nc” match monthly level-3 mapped chlorophyll data SeaWiFS satellite 9km resolution, netcdf format. pattern passed search argument bb_handler_oceandata handler function. Note bb_handler_oceandata need source_url specified bb_source call. Note 1-Jan-2020, Oceandata users require EarthData login. need provide username password bb_source call, also need authorize ‘OB.DAAC Data Access’ application EarthData account (see ‘Applications’ https://urs.earthdata.nasa.gov/profile). , sake small example, ’ll limit single file (“T20000322000060.L3m_MO_PAR_par_9km.nc”, photosynthetically-active radiation Terra satellite February 2000):
code: src4 <- bb_source(     name = "Oceandata test file",     id = "oceandata-test",     description = "Monthly, 9km remote-sensed PAR from the MODIS Terra satellite",     doc_url = "https://oceancolor.gsfc.nasa.gov/",     citation = "See https://oceancolor.gsfc.nasa.gov/cms/citations",     license = "Please cite",     method = list("bb_handler_oceandata", search="T20000322000060.L3m_MO_PAR_par_9km.nc"),     user = "your_earthdata_username",     password = "your_earthdata_password",     data_group = "Ocean data")  ## add this source to a configuration and synchronize it: cf <- bb_config("c:/temp/data/bbtest") %>% bb_add(src4) status <- bb_sync(cf)  ## and our local copy of this data file: status$files[[1]]$file

Commonly choose destination data directory persistent location, suitable data library. demonstration purposes ’ll just use temporary directory:: Bowerbird must told data sources synchronize. Let’s use data Australian 2016 federal election, provided one example data sources: configuration defined data source added , can run sync process. set verbose = TRUE see additional progress output: Congratulations! now local copy chosen data set. particular example fairly small (10MB), take long download. title: Initialize a bowerbird configuration — bb_config
text: configuration object controls behaviour bowerbird synchronization process, run via bb_sync(my_config). configuration object defines data sources synchronized, data files sources stored, range options controlling synchronization process conducted. parameters provided repository-wide settings, affect data sources subsequently added configuration.

title: Initialize a bowerbird configuration — bb_config
code: bb_config(   local_file_root,   wget_global_flags = list(restrict_file_names = "windows", progress = "dot:giga"),   http_proxy = NULL,   ftp_proxy = NULL,   clobber = 1 )

title: Initialize a bowerbird configuration — bb_config
text: local_file_root string: location data repository local file system wget_global_flags list: wget flags applied data sources call bb_wget. appended data-source-specific wget flags provided via source's method argument http_proxy string: URL HTTP proxy use e.g. 'http://.proxy:8080' (NULL proxy) ftp_proxy string: URL FTP proxy use e.g. 'http://.proxy:21' (NULL proxy) clobber numeric: 0=overwrite existing files, 1=overwrite remote file newer local copy, 2=always overwrite existing files

Support tar files may depend platform (see untar). data source delivers compressed files, likely want decompress downloading. functions . default, delete compressed files decompressing. reason next synchronization run, local (compressed) copy can compared remote compressed copy, download can skipped nothing changed. Deleting local compressed files save space file system, may result every file re-downloaded every synchronization run.

what: Convenience function to define and synchronize a bowerbird data collection — bb_get
title: Convenience function to define and synchronize a bowerbird data collection — bb_get
text: convenience function provides shorthand method synchronizing small number data sources. call bb_get(...) roughly equivalent bb_sync(bb_add(bb_config(...), ...), ...) (take dots literally , just indicating argument placeholders).

title: Convenience function to define and synchronize a bowerbird data collection — bb_get
code: bb_get(   data_sources,   local_file_root,   clobber = 1,   http_proxy = NULL,   ftp_proxy = NULL,   create_root = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE,   confirm_downloads_larger_than = 0.1,   dry_run = FALSE,   ... )

title: Convenience function to define and synchronize a bowerbird data collection — bb_get
text: data_sources tibble: one data sources download, returned e.g. bb_example_sources local_file_root string: location data repository local file system clobber numeric: 0=overwrite existing files, 1=overwrite remote file newer local copy, 2=always overwrite existing files http_proxy string: URL HTTP proxy use e.g. 'http://.proxy:8080' (NULL proxy) ftp_proxy string: URL FTP proxy use e.g. 'http://.proxy:21' (NULL proxy) create_root logical: data root directory created exist? FALSE (default) data root directory exist, error generated verbose logical: TRUE, provide additional progress output confirm_downloads_larger_than numeric NULL: non-negative, bb_sync ask user confirmation download data source size greater number (GB). value zero trigger confirmation every data source. negative NULL value prompt confirmation. Note applies R used interactively. expected download size taken collection_size parameter data source, accuracy dependent accuracy data source definition dry_run logical: TRUE, bb_sync dry run synchronization process without actually downloading files ... : additional parameters passed bb_config bb_sync

title: Convenience function to define and synchronize a bowerbird data collection — bb_get
text: tibble, bb_sync

title: Convenience function to define and synchronize a bowerbird data collection — bb_get
text: Note local_file_root directory must exist create_root=TRUE must passed.

title: Convenience function to define and synchronize a bowerbird data collection — bb_get
code: if (FALSE) {   my_source <- bb_example_sources("Australian Election 2016 House of Representatives data")   status <- bb_get(local_file_root = tempdir(), data_sources = my_source, verbose = TRUE)    ## the files that have been downloaded:   status$files[[1]]    ## Define a new source: Geelong bicycle paths from data.gov.au   my_source <- bb_source(     name = "Bike Paths - Greater Geelong",     id = "http://data.gov.au/dataset/7af9cf59-a4ea-47b2-8652-5e5eeed19611",     doc_url = "https://data.gov.au/dataset/geelong-bike-paths",     citation = "See https://data.gov.au/dataset/geelong-bike-paths",     source_url = "https://data.gov.au/dataset/7af9cf59-a4ea-47b2-8652-5e5eeed19611",     license = "CC-BY",     method = list("bb_handler_rget", accept_download = "\\.zip$", level = 1),     postprocess = list("bb_unzip"))    ## get the data   status <- bb_get(data_sources = my_source, local_file_root = tempdir(), verbose = TRUE)    ## find the .shp file amongst the files, and plot it   shpfile <- status$files[[1]]$file[grepl("shp$", status$files[[1]]$file)]   library(sf)   bx <- read_st(shpfile)   plot(bx) }

what: Handler for public AWS S3 data sources — bb_handler_aws_s3
title: Handler for public AWS S3 data sources — bb_handler_aws_s3
text: handler function used AWS S3 data providers. function intended called directly, rather specified method option bb_source. Note currently works public data sources accessible without S3 key. method arguments accepted bb_handler_aws_s3 currently: "bucket" string: name bucket (defaults "") "base_url" string: s3HTTP "region" string: s3HTTP "use_https" logical: s3HTTP "prefix" string: get_bucket; keys bucket begin specified prefix processed parameters passed bb_rget function, including "accept_download", "accept_download_extra", "reject_download" Note "prefix", "accept_download", "accept_download_extra", "reject_download" parameters can used restrict files downloaded bucket.

title: Handler for public AWS S3 data sources — bb_handler_aws_s3
code: if (FALSE) {   ## an example AWS S3 data source   src <- bb_source(            name = "SILO climate data",            id = "silo-open-data",            description = "Australian climate data from 1889 to yesterday.                           This source includes a single example monthly rainfall data file.                           Adjust the 'accept_download' parameter to change this.",            doc_url = "https://www.longpaddock.qld.gov.au/silo/gridded-data/",            citation = "SILO datasets are constructed by the Queensland Government using                        observational data provided by the Australian Bureau of Meteorology                        and are available under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 license",            license = "CC-BY 4.0",            method = list("bb_handler_aws_s3", region = "silo-open-data.s3",                          base_url = "amazonaws.com", prefix = "Official/annual/monthly_rain/",                          accept_download = "2005\\.monthly_rain\\.nc$"),            comment = "The unusual specification of region and base_url is a workaround for                       an aws.s3 issue, see https://github.com/cloudyr/aws.s3/issues/318",            postprocess = NULL,            collection_size = 0.02,            data_group = "Climate")    temp_root <- tempdir()    status <- bb_get(src, local_file_root = temp_root, verbose = TRUE) }

title: Handler for Oceandata data sets — bb_handler_oceandata
text: search string: (required) search string pass oceancolor file searcher (https://oceandata.sci.gsfc.nasa.gov/api/file_search) dtype string: (optional) data type (e.g. "L3m") pass oceancolor file searcher. Valid options time writing aquarius, seawifs, aqua, terra, meris, octs, czcs, hico, viirs (snpp), viirsj1, s3olci (sentinel-3a), s3bolci (see https://oceancolor.gsfc.nasa.gov/data/download_methods/) sensor string: (optional) sensor (e.g. "seawifs") pass oceancolor file searcher. Valid options time writing L0, L1, L2, L3b (binned data), L3m (mapped data), MET (ancillary data), misc (sundry products) ... : extra parameters passed automatically bb_sync

title: Handler for Oceandata data sets — bb_handler_oceandata
text: Note users need Earthdata login, see https://urs.earthdata.nasa.gov/. Users also need authorize application 'OB.DAAC Data Access' (see 'Applications' https://urs.earthdata.nasa.gov/profile) Oceandata uses standardized file naming conventions (see https://oceancolor.gsfc.nasa.gov/docs/format/), know products want can construct suitable file name pattern search . example, "S*L3m_MO_CHL_chlor_a_9km.nc" match monthly level-3 mapped chlorophyll data SeaWiFS satellite 9km resolution, netcdf format. pattern passed search argument. Note bb_handler_oceandata take need `source_url` specified bb_source call.

title: Modify a data source — bb_modify_source
text: exception method postprocess parameters, parameter provided entirely replace equivalent src object. Pass new value NULL remove existing parameter. method postprocess parameters lists, modification takes place list-element level: element new list replace equivalent element list src. src list contain element, added. illustrate, say created data source : src <- bb_source(method=list("bb_handler_rget", parm1 = value1, parm2 = value2), ...) Calling bb_modify_source(src, method = list(parm1 = newvalue1)) result new method value list("bb_handler_rget", parm1 = newvalue1, parm2 = value2) Modifying postprocess elements similar. Note currently possible entirely remove postprocess component using function. need , need manually.

title: Modify a data source — bb_modify_source
code: ## this pre-defined source requires a username and password src <- bb_example_sources(           "Sea Ice Trends and Climatologies from SMMR and SSM/I-SSMIS, Version 3")  ## add username and password src <- bb_modify_source(src,user="myusername",password="mypassword")  ## or using the pipe operator src <- bb_example_sources(           "Sea Ice Trends and Climatologies from SMMR and SSM/I-SSMIS, Version 3") %>%   bb_modify_source(user="myusername",password="mypassword")  ## remove the existing "data_group" component src %>% bb_modify_source(data_group=NULL) #> # A tibble: 1 × 16 #>   id               name  description doc_url source_url citation license comment #>   <chr>            <chr> <chr>       <chr>   <list>     <chr>    <chr>   <chr>   #> 1 10.5067/IJ0T7HF… Sea … NSIDC prov… https:… <chr [1]>  Stroeve… Please… NA      #> # ℹ 8 more variables: method <list>, postprocess <list>, #> #   authentication_note <chr>, user <chr>, password <chr>, #> #   access_function <chr>, data_group <chr>, collection_size <dbl>  ## change just the 'level' setting of an existing method definition src %>% bb_modify_source(method=list(level=3)) #> # A tibble: 1 × 16 #>   id               name  description doc_url source_url citation license comment #>   <chr>            <chr> <chr>       <chr>   <list>     <chr>    <chr>   <chr>   #> 1 10.5067/IJ0T7HF… Sea … NSIDC prov… https:… <chr [1]>  Stroeve… Please… NA      #> # ℹ 8 more variables: method <list>, postprocess <list>, #> #   authentication_note <chr>, user <chr>, password <chr>, #> #   access_function <chr>, data_group <chr>, collection_size <dbl>  ## remove the 'level' component of an existing method definition src %>% bb_modify_source(method=list(level=NULL)) #> # A tibble: 1 × 16 #>   id               name  description doc_url source_url citation license comment #>   <chr>            <chr> <chr>       <chr>   <list>     <chr>    <chr>   <chr>   #> 1 10.5067/IJ0T7HF… Sea … NSIDC prov… https:… <chr [1]>  Stroeve… Please… NA      #> # ℹ 8 more variables: method <list>, postprocess <list>, #> #   authentication_note <chr>, user <chr>, password <chr>, #> #   access_function <chr>, data_group <chr>, collection_size <dbl>

title: A recursive download utility — bb_rget
text: function provides similar, simplified, functionality command-line wget utility. based rvest package.

title: A recursive download utility — bb_rget
code: bb_rget(   url,   level = 0,   wait = 0,   accept_follow = c("(/|\\.html?)$"),   reject_follow = character(),   accept_download = bb_rget_default_downloads(),   accept_download_extra = character(),   reject_download = character(),   user,   password,   clobber = 1,   no_parent = TRUE,   no_check_certificate = FALSE,   relative = FALSE,   remote_time = TRUE,   verbose = FALSE,   show_progress = verbose,   debug = FALSE,   dry_run = FALSE,   stop_on_download_error = FALSE,   force_local_filename,   use_url_directory = TRUE,   no_host = FALSE,   cut_dirs = 0L,   link_css = "a",   curl_opts )  bb_rget_default_downloads()

title: A recursive download utility — bb_rget
text: url string: URL retrieve level integer >=0: recursively download maximum depth level. Specify 0 recursion wait numeric >=0: wait number seconds successive retrievals. option may help servers block users making many requests short period time accept_follow character: character vector one entries. entry specifies regular expression applied complete URL. URLs matching entries followed spidering process. Note first URL (provided via url parameter) always visited, unless matches download criteria reject_follow character: accept_follow, specifying URL regular expressions reject accept_download character: character vector one entries. entry specifies regular expression applied complete URL. URLs match entries accepted download. default accept_download parameter returned bb_rget_default_downloads: use bb_rget_default_downloads() see accept_download_extra character: character vector one entries. provided, URLs accepted download match entries accept_download entries accept_download_extra. convenient method add one extra download types, without needing re-specify defaults accept_download reject_download character: accept_regex, specifying URL regular expressions reject user string: username used authenticate remote server password string: password used authenticate remote server clobber numeric: 0=overwrite existing files, 1=overwrite remote file newer local copy, 2=always overwrite existing files no_parent logical: TRUE, ever ascend parent directory retrieving recursively. TRUE default, bacause guarantees files certain hierarchy downloaded. Note check applies links host starting url. URL links files another host, links followed (unless relative = TRUE) no_check_certificate logical: TRUE, check server certificate available certificate authorities. Also require URL host name match common name presented certificate. option might useful trying download files server expired certificate, clearly security risk used caution relative logical: TRUE, follow relative links. can useful restricting downloaded recursive mode remote_time logical: TRUE, attempt set local file's time remote file verbose logical: print trace output? show_progress logical: TRUE, show download progress debug logical: TRUE, print additional debugging information. bb_rget behaving expected, try setting TRUE dry_run logical: TRUE, spider remote site work files downloaded, download stop_on_download_error logical: TRUE, download process stop file download fails. FALSE, process issue warning continue next file download force_local_filename string: provided, url treated single URL (recursion conducted). downloaded file name, local directory determined url use_url_directory logical: TRUE, files saved local directory follows URL structure (e.g. files http://./place saved directory ./place). FALSE, files saved current directory no_host logical: use_url_directory = TRUE, specifying no_host = TRUE remove host name directory (e.g. files files http://./place saved directory place) cut_dirs integer: use_url_directory = TRUE, specifying cut_dirs remove many directory levels path local directory files saved (e.g. cut_dirs = 2, files http://./place/baa/haa saved directory ./haa. cut_dirs = 1 no_host = TRUE, files http://./place/baa/haa saved directory baa/haa) link_css string: css selector identifies links (passed css parameter html_elements). Note link elements must href attribute curl_opts named list: options use curl downloads, passed .list parameter curl::new_handle

title: Define a data source — bb_source

title: Define a data source — bb_source
code: bb_source(   id,   name,   description = NA_character_,   doc_url,   source_url,   citation,   license,   comment = NA_character_,   method,   postprocess,   authentication_note = NA_character_,   user = NA_character_,   password = NA_character_,   access_function = NA_character_,   data_group = NA_character_,   collection_size = NA,   warn_empty_auth = TRUE )

title: Define a data source — bb_source
text: id string: (required) unique identifier data source. data source DOI, use . Otherwise, original data provider identifier dataset, probably good choice (include data version number one). ID something changes data set changes (updated). DOI ideal name string: (required) unique name data source. human-readable still concise name description string: plain-language description data source, provided users can get idea data source contains (full details can consult doc_url link) doc_url string: (required) URL metadata record documentation data source source_url character vector: one source URLs. Required bb_handler_rget, although method functions might require one citation string: (required) details citation data source license string: (required) description license. standard licenses (e.g. creative commons) include license descriptor ("CC-", etc) comment string: comments data source. part original data collection mirrored, mention method list (required): list object defines function used synchronize data source. first element list function name (string function). Additional list elements can used specify additional parameters pass function. Note bb_sync automatically passes data repository configuration object first parameter method handler function. handler function uses bb_rget (e.g. bb_handler_rget), extra parameters passed bb_rget function postprocess list: element postprocess defines postprocessing step run main synchronization happened. element list can function string function name, list style list(fun,arg1=val1,arg2=val2) fun function called arg1 arg2 additional parameters pass function authentication_note string: authentication required order access data source, make note process (include URL registration page, possible) user string: username, required password string: password, required access_function string: can used suggest users appropriate function read data files. Provide name R function even code snippet data_group string: name group data source belongs. Useful arranging sources terms thematic areas collection_size numeric: approximate disk space (GB) used data collection, known. data supplied compressed files, size reflect disk space used decompression. data_source definition contains multiple source_url entries, size reflect overall disk space used combined warn_empty_auth logical: TRUE, issue warning data source requires authentication (authentication_note NA) user password provided. Set FALSE defining data source others use credentials: typically call data source constructor modify user password components

title: Define a data source — bb_source
text: tibble columns per function arguments (excluding warn_empty_auth)

title: Define a data source — bb_source
text: method parameter defines handler function used synchronize data source, extra parameters need passed . Parameters marked "required" minimal set needed define data source. parameters either relevant data sources (e.g. postprocess, user, password) provide metadata users strictly necessary allow data source synchronized (e.g. description, access_function, data_group). Note three "required" parameters (namely citation, license, doc_url) strictly needed synchronization code, treated "required" fundamental importance reproducible science. See vignette("bowerbird") examples discussion defining data sources.

title: Define a data source — bb_source
code: ## a minimal definition for the GSHHG coastline data set:  my_source <- bb_source(    id = "gshhg_coastline",    name = "GSHHG coastline data",    doc_url = "http://www.soest.hawaii.edu/pwessel/gshhg",    citation = "Wessel, P., and W. H. F. Smith, A Global Self-consistent, Hierarchical,      High-resolution Shoreline Database, J. Geophys. Res., 101, 8741-8743, 1996",    source_url = "ftp://ftp.soest.hawaii.edu/gshhg/",    license = "LGPL",    method = list("bb_handler_rget",level = 1, accept_download = "README|bin.*\\.zip$"))  ## a more complete definition, which unzips the files after downloading and also ##  provides an indication of the size of the dataset  my_source <- bb_source(    id = "gshhg_coastline",    name = "GSHHG coastline data",    description = "A Global Self-consistent, Hierarchical, High-resolution Geography Database",    doc_url = "http://www.soest.hawaii.edu/pwessel/gshhg",    citation = "Wessel, P., and W. H. F. Smith, A Global Self-consistent, Hierarchical,      High-resolution Shoreline Database, J. Geophys. Res., 101, 8741-8743, 1996",    source_url = "ftp://ftp.soest.hawaii.edu/gshhg/*",    license = "LGPL",    method = list("bb_handler_rget", level = 1, accept_download = "README|bin.*\\.zip$"),    postprocess = list("bb_unzip"),    collection_size = 0.6)  ## define a data repository configuration cf <- bb_config("/my/repo/root")  ## add this source to the repository cf <- bb_add(cf, my_source)  if (FALSE) { ## sync the repo bb_sync(cf) }

title: Run a bowerbird data repository synchronization — bb_sync
text: config bb_config: configuration returned bb_config create_root logical: data root directory created exist? FALSE (default) data root directory exist, error generated verbose logical: TRUE, provide additional progress output catch_errors logical: TRUE, catch errors continue synchronization process. sync process works data sources sequentially, catch_errors FALSE, error synchronization one data source prevent subsequent data sources synchronizing confirm_downloads_larger_than numeric NULL: non-negative, bb_sync ask user confirmation download data source size greater number (GB). value zero trigger confirmation every data source. negative NULL value prompt confirmation. Note applies R used interactively. expected download size taken collection_size parameter data source, accuracy dependent accuracy data source definition dry_run logical: TRUE, bb_sync dry run synchronization process without actually downloading files

title: Run a bowerbird data repository synchronization — bb_sync
text: tibble name, id, source_url, sync success status, files data source. Data sources contain multiple source URLs appear multiple rows returned tibble, one per source_url. files tibble columns url (URL file downloaded ), file (path file), note (either "downloaded" file downloaded, "local copy" file downloaded already local copy, "decompressed" files extracted downloaded (already-locally-present) compressed file. url NA "decompressed" files

text: Note bb_sync run, local_file_root directory must exist create_root=TRUE must specified (.e. bb_sync(...,create_root=TRUE)). create_root=FALSE directory exist, bb_sync fail error.

title: Run a bowerbird data repository synchronization — bb_sync
code: if (FALSE) {   ## Choose a location to store files on the local file system.   ## Normally this would be an explicit choice by the user, but here   ## we just use a temporary directory for example purposes.    td <- tempdir()   cf <- bb_config(local_file_root = td)    ## Bowerbird must then be told which data sources to synchronize.   ## Let's use data from the Australian 2016 federal election, which is provided as one   ## of the example data sources:    my_source <- bb_example_sources("Australian Election 2016 House of Representatives data")    ## Add this data source to the configuration:    cf <- bb_add(cf, my_source)    ## Once the configuration has been defined and the data source added to it,   ## we can run the sync process.   ## We set \code{verbose=TRUE} so that we see additional progress output:    status <- bb_sync(cf, verbose = TRUE)    ## The files in this data set have been stored in a data-source specific   ## subdirectory of our local file root:    status$files[[1]]    ## We can run this at any later time and our repository will update if the source has changed:    status2 <- bb_sync(cf, verbose = TRUE) }

Call bb_wget("help") get information wget's command line flags. required, command-line flags without equivalent bb_wget function parameters can passed via extra_flags parameter.

title: Make a wget call — bb_wget
code: bb_wget(   url,   recursive = TRUE,   level = 1,   wait = 0,   accept,   reject,   accept_regex,   reject_regex,   exclude_directories,   restrict_file_names,   progress,   user,   password,   output_file,   robots_off = FALSE,   timestamping = FALSE,   no_if_modified_since = FALSE,   no_clobber = FALSE,   no_parent = TRUE,   no_check_certificate = FALSE,   relative = FALSE,   adjust_extension = FALSE,   retr_symlinks = FALSE,   extra_flags = character(),   verbose = FALSE,   capture_stdout = FALSE,   quiet = FALSE,   debug = FALSE )

title: Make a wget call — bb_wget
text: url string: URL retrieve recursive logical: true, turn recursive retrieving level integer >=0: recursively download maximum depth level. applicable recursive=TRUE. Specify 0 infinite recursion. See https://www.gnu.org/software/wget/manual/wget.html#Recursive-Download information wget's recursive downloading wait numeric >=0: wait number seconds successive retrievals. option may help servers block multiple successive requests, introducing delay requests accept character: character vector one entries. entry specifies comma-separated list filename suffixes patterns accept. Note wildcard characters '*', '?', '[', ']' appear element accept, treated filename pattern, rather filename suffix. case, enclose pattern quotes, example accept="\"*.csv\"" reject character: accept, specifying filename suffixes patterns reject accept_regex character: character vector one entries. entry provides regular expression applied complete URL. Matching URLs accepted download reject_regex character: accept_regex, specifying regular expressions reject exclude_directories character: character vector one entries. entry specifies comma-separated list directories wish exclude download. Elements may contain wildcards restrict_file_names character: vector one strings set "unix", "windows", "nocontrol", "ascii", "lowercase", "uppercase". See https://www.gnu.org/software/wget/manual/wget.html#index-Windows-file-names information parameter. bb_config sets "windows" default: downloading files server port (http://somewhere.org:1234/) Unix allow ":" part directory/file names, Windows (":" replaced "+"). Specifying restrict_file_names="windows" causes Windows-style file naming used progress string: type progress indicator wish use. Legal indicators "dot" "bar". "dot" prints progress dots, dot representing fixed amount downloaded data. style can adjusted: "dot:mega" show 64K per dot 3M per line; "dot:giga" shows 1M per dot 32M per line. See https://www.gnu.org/software/wget/manual/wget.html#index-dot-style information user string: username used authenticate remote server password string: password used authenticate remote server output_file string: save wget's output messages file robots_off logical: default wget considers robot, therefore recurse areas site excluded robots. can cause problems servers exclude robots (accidentally deliberately) parts sites containing data want retrieve. Setting robots_off=TRUE add "-e robots=" flag, instructs wget behave human user, robot. See https://www.gnu.org/software/wget/manual/wget.html#Robot-Exclusion information robot exclusion timestamping logical: TRUE, re-retrieve remote file unless newer local copy (local copy) no_if_modified_since logical: applies retrieving recursively timestamping (.e. downloading files changed since last download, achieved using bb_config(...,clobber=1)). default method timestamping issue "-Modified-Since" header request, instructs remote server return file changed since specified date. servers support header. cases, trying using no_if_modified_since=TRUE, instead send preliminary HEAD request ascertain date remote file no_clobber logical: TRUE, skip downloads overwrite existing local files no_parent logical: TRUE, ever ascend parent directory retrieving recursively. TRUE default, bacause guarantees files certain hierarchy downloaded no_check_certificate logical: TRUE, check server certificate available certificate authorities. Also require URL host name match common name presented certificate. option might useful trying download files server expired certificate, clearly security risk used caution relative logical: TRUE, follow relative links. can sometimes useful restricting downloaded recursive mode adjust_extension logical: file type 'application/xhtml+xml' 'text/html' downloaded URL end .htm .html, option cause suffix '.html' appended local filename. can useful mirroring remote site file URLs conflict directories (e.g. http://somewhere.org//page content , say http://somewhere.org//page/. "somewhere.org//page" saved file name, name also used local directory name store lower-level content. Setting adjust_extension=TRUE cause page saved "somewhere.org//page.html", thus resolving conflict retr_symlinks logical: TRUE, follow symbolic links recursive download. Note follow symlinks files, directories extra_flags character: character vector additional command-line flags pass wget verbose logical: print trace output? capture_stdout logical: TRUE, return 'stdout' 'stderr' output returned object (see exec_internal sys package). Otherwise send outputs console quiet logical: TRUE, suppress wget's output debug logical: TRUE, wget print lots debugging information. wget behaving expected, try setting TRUE
